title: cuda() call slow on Nvidia Quadro
body_html:
The call to model.cuda() takes several minutes to complete, after which everything works as expected. It seems similar to this issue: #537 I tried installing via both pip and conda, but both had the same issue. I'm guessing this is due to PyTorch not having built-in support for the Quadro?

OS: Linux
GPU: Nvidia Quadro P3000
Driver: Nvidia 390.25
Python 3.6
CUDA version 9.1
Torch 0.3.1 with CUDA 9

body:
The call to model.cuda() takes several minutes to complete, after which everything works as expected. It seems similar to this issue: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/537 I tried installing via both pip and conda, but both had the same issue. I'm guessing this is due to PyTorch not having built-in support for the Quadro?

OS: Linux
GPU: Nvidia Quadro P3000
Driver: Nvidia 390.25
Python 3.6
CUDA version 9.1
Torch 0.3.1 with CUDA 9
